trends: There have been 12 other sightings in Corydon
There were no other sightings in Corydon on or around July 7th 2009
divs: sighting detailsit is 4:50am now , i am finishing up listening to coast2coast a.m.,and went to check the front door ,turn off lights,etc.,when i here dogs barking,that all too familiar sound in their voice that i have become aware of when "ufo's" are near...so i stepped out the front door to the porch and listened closer to their barks,it wasn't my dogs but the neighbors' and yes they definitely had "that" tone to their barks ,so i stepped outside all the way to get a look at the sky,and sure enough,i see one right off the bat.(my dog was lying right in the front yard and was listening to the other dogs but not too worried since they aren't over "our" house this time.)so i go back in grab my binoculars and camera,and head back out.when i get out there i discover that there isn't one but two,the first one is farther off,maybe nearer to hwy 62,idk,and is flickering brilliantly the typical blues,reds,and yellowish whites,that we have seen out here before,yet lower and closer than most of those.it is over towards the n.e.,& higher altitude than the other,but stationary.maybe about 65 or 70 degrees from horizon.the second one is more towards the e.,at an altitude not much higher than the neighbors pole light ,by 1 finger width,possibly at a 55 degree angle ,and is a bright yellowish\white light very bright,as bright as the pole light in front of it ,but slightly smaller .(the pole light from my house is approx. the size of a softball,but up close more the size of a grapefruit ,and the ufo light was approx. the size of a baseball in comparison.)also stationary,and when looked at through the binocs.,appears as a disk shaped object, on it's end.and much closer than the other,in the binocs. it is very clear to see.so,i go back in after attempting to take some pics.,which i don't think will turn out due to it being so dark,and woke my teen daughter to come look.when we get back outside,they both appear to be in the same place as before,until we look through binocs. again and this time the second,closer one is on a slant more diagonally instead of on it's end ,like before. but both look to her the same as they do to me through the binocs.,as i had her describe to me what she was seeing.they are still there as i report this,and i'd expect like before they shall remain there for awhile.we hadn't seen any for a month or so now,and today is my birthday ,so what a treat for me!!! these things are amazingly beautiful,and even though we are a bit leery of them ,we are not really afraid anymore,and i'd love to see another up close view...you can tell my areas investigators that they're heeerre again.:)i'm going back out for another look before bed and will be listening for my dog to have "that" tone to his bark...i have just went back out to look again ,it is now 5:11a.m. and they are still approx. the same distance from each other but have both moved to the right,meaning the multi-colored one is now over near the neighbors pole light and the larger whitish light is almost over top of our road,if i had to est. the distance moved i would say,using my arm,it is from elbow to finger tip length.(no way they are planets,stars, or satellites either,imo.)
